New Records: Matt Wallner homered for the second straight game
Brooks Lee snapped an 0-for-19 stretch with a go-ahead, two-run double
Royce Lewis nearly had his sixth career grand slam
Willi Castro had an RBI single to snap an 0-for-16 skid
Nolan Schanuel had his 13th homer of the season
Jordyn Adams added his first career homer
Key Match Events: Matt Wallner's 13th homer into the bullpens in left-center field tied the game
Brooks Lee's go-ahead, two-run double in the seventh inning
Royce Lewis' drive was initially called a home run but was reversed to a two-run double
Willi Castro's RBI single in the fourth inning
Jhoan Duran secured his 23rd save in the ninth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Minnesota manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the team's good energy and at-bats
Rookie starter Jack Kochanowicz allowed four runs in 5 2/3 innings for the Angels
Post-Match Reflections: Matt Wallner expressed pride in the team's resilience
Rocco Baldelli highlighted the victory as pivotal for the Twins' playoff push
Jordyn Adams reflected on his first career homer
Ron Washington discussed Bryce Teodosio's injury
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins remain six games behind Cleveland and 1 1/2 behind Kansas City in the AL Central
The Twins are three ahead of Detroit for the final AL wild-card spot
Angels: LHP Sam Aldegheri is scheduled to start Friday against the Astros
Twins: RHP Bailey Ober will start Friday's game against the Reds
Others: Byron Buxton is activated from the 10-day injured list
Austin Martin is sent to Triple-A St. Paul
Manuel Margot is reinstated from the injured list
Christian Vázquez is reinstated from the paternity list
Jaír Camargo and Michael Helman are optioned to Triple-A
